title: Regional Sponsored Migration Scheme (subclasses 119 and 857)
summary: This page provides information about the Regional Sponsored Migration Scheme visa (subclasses 119 and 857), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2012. It explains rules for applicants who applied before the closure, details on adding family members, visa benefits, holder obligations, and employer obligations.

conditions: must notify the department in writing
family members must be nominated by the employer
family members must meet health and character requirements
adding_family_members.reference: including family members in your application

benefits: apply for Australian citizenship if eligible
sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
travel to and from Australia for five years from visa grant date (resident return visa required after)

possible_cancellation_conditions: not starting employment with the relevant employer within six months of arriving in Australia and failing to satisfy the Minister that a genuine effort was made
employment terminating within two years of commencement and failing to satisfy the Minister that a genuine effort was made to remain employed for the required period

changes_to_report: changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
notification_requirements.reference: how to let us know if there is a change in your situation

family_member_information.family_members_of_visa_holders: can apply separately for a visa

requirements: ensure all relevant workplace laws are met
ensure all award conditions are met
